input_text: In linear algebra, we can perform row operations on matrices. When we subtract half of row 1 from row 2, we create an equivalent system that preserves all solutions.

input_data.input_text: In linear algebra, we can perform row operations on matrices. When we subtract half of row 1 from row 2, we create an equivalent system that preserves all solutions.
input_data.ssml:
<speak version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/synthesis"
    xmlns:mstts="https://www.w3.org/2001/mstts" xml:lang="en-US">
    <voice name="en-US-JennyNeural">
        <mstts:express-as style="friendly">In linear algebra, we can perform row operations on matrices. When we subtract half of row 1 from row 2, we create an equivalent system that preserves all solutions.</mstts:express-as>
    </voice>
</speak>

ssml:
<speak version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/synthesis"
    xmlns:mstts="https://www.w3.org/2001/mstts" xml:lang="en-US">
    <voice name="en-US-JennyNeural">
        <mstts:express-as style="friendly">In linear algebra, we can perform row operations on matrices. When we subtract half of row 1 from row 2, we create an equivalent system that preserves all solutions.</mstts:express-as>
    </voice>
</speak>

input_text: In elementary row operations, we can swap any two rows. Watch as we swap rows 1 and 2 of this matrix, moving the rows into their new positions while maintaining the rest of the matrix unchanged.

input_data.input_text: In elementary row operations, we can swap any two rows. Watch as we swap rows 1 and 2 of this matrix, moving the rows into their new positions while maintaining the rest of the matrix unchanged.

    </voice>
</speak>

    </voice>
</speak>

input_text: We multiply each element in the first row by 2, transforming the values. Watch as 2 becomes 4, 4 becomes 8, and 1 becomes 2, while the other rows stay unchanged.

    </voice>
</speak>

    </voice>
</speak>

input_text: When we add one row to another in a matrix, we add the numbers in each position. Watch as we add Row 1 to Row 2, combining 3 plus 2 and 4 plus 1 to get our new row of 5 and 5.

input_data.input_text: When we add one row to another in a matrix, we add the numbers in each position. Watch as we add Row 1 to Row 2, combining 3 plus 2 and 4 plus 1 to get our new row of 5 and 5.

        <mstts:express-as style="friendly">When we add one row to another in a matrix, we add the numbers in each position. Watch as we add Row 1 to Row 2, combining 3 plus 2 and 4 plus 1 to get our new row of 5 and 5.</mstts:express-as>
    </voice>
</speak>

    </voice>
</speak>

input_text: Lets simplify this matrix by performing row operations. We multiply the first row by one half and subtract it from the second row to obtain zeros below our pivot, giving us our row echelon form.
